name: DashboardChildComponent

inputsClass.rawdescription: All classes added to this child

inputsClass.name: data
inputsClass.rawdescription: The data object can be used as a dataTransfer object for events of the child.
inputsClass.description: The data object can be used as a dataTransfer object for events of the child.

inputsClass.name: editMode
inputsClass.rawdescription:
If a dashboard editing is disabled no widgets can be moved, edited, removed
or added.
inputsClass.description: If a dashboard editing is disabled no widgets can be moved, edited, removed or added.

inputsClass.name: height
inputsClass.rawdescription: The height of the component in grid-rows.
inputsClass.description: The height of the component in grid-rows.

inputsClass.name: isFrozen
inputsClass.rawdescription:
If a dashboard is frozen, all children cannot be moved
or resized.
inputsClass.description: If a dashboard is frozen, all children cannot be moved or resized.

inputsClass.name: margin
inputsClass.rawdescription: The margin of the child in pixel.
inputsClass.description: The margin of the child in pixel.

inputsClass.name: useIntersection
inputsClass.rawdescription: The child content is initialized, as soon it is scrolled into viewport
inputsClass.description: The child content is initialized, as soon it is scrolled into viewport

inputsClass.name: width
inputsClass.rawdescription: The width of the component in grid-columns.
inputsClass.description: The width of the component in grid-columns.

inputsClass.name: x
inputsClass.rawdescription: The x position of the child.

inputsClass.name: y
inputsClass.rawdescription: The y position of the child.

outputsClass.name: changeEnd
outputsClass.rawdescription: An event fired if a child change is ended
outputsClass.description: An event fired if a child change is ended

outputsClass.name: changeStart
outputsClass.rawdescription: An event fired if a child change is started (dragging or resizing)
outputsClass.description: An event fired if a child change is started (dragging or resizing)

outputsClass.name: toggleFullscreen
outputsClass.rawdescription: An event fired if the fullscreen toggle button was pressed.
outputsClass.description: An event fired if the fullscreen toggle button was pressed.

propertiesClass.name: changeSubscription
propertiesClass.description: The observable subscription which is listen to on changes (drag or resize).
propertiesClass.rawdescription:
The observable subscription which is listen to
on changes (drag or resize).

propertiesClass.name: intersected
propertiesClass.description: An indicator if the child is intersected (that mean visible for the user)
propertiesClass.rawdescription: An indicator if the child is intersected (that mean visible for the user)

propertiesClass.name: isOneColumnView$
propertiesClass.description: Triggers on every resize and returns true if in one column view (mobile view)
propertiesClass.rawdescription: Triggers on every resize and returns true if in one column view (mobile view)

propertiesClass.name: lastChange
propertiesClass.description: Tells if the last change was a dragging or resizing event;
propertiesClass.rawdescription: Tells if the last change was a dragging or resizing event;

description:
A dashboard child allows to position elements correctly on a grid.

By setting c8y-dashboard-child-actions and c8y-dashboard-child-title on the element you can add custom actions or a custom title to the current child.

By adding the correct branded classes, you can define the look and feel of the child. By default it is displayed as a card.

Example :
  <c8y-dashboard-child
    #cpWidget3
    [x]="0"
    [y]="3"
    [width]="4"
    [height]="4"
    [class]="'card-dashboard panel-content-transparent'"
  >
    <c8y-dashboard-child-title *ngIf="showTitle">
      <span>Transparent!</span>
    </c8y-dashboard-child-title>
    <c8y-dashboard-child-action>
      <a href="" (click)="showTitle = !showTitle; (false)">
        <i [c8yIcon]="'heading'"></i> Hide/show title
      </a>
    </c8y-dashboard-child-action>
    x: {{ cpWidget3.x }}<br />
    y: {{ cpWidget3.y }}<br />
    width: {{ cpWidget3.width }}<br />
    height: {{ cpWidget3.height }}<br />
  </c8y-dashboard-child>
rawdescription:
A dashboard child allows to position elements correctly on a grid. By setting `c8y-dashboard-child-actions` and `c8y-dashboard-child-title` on the element you can add custom actions or a custom title to the current child. By adding the correct branded classes, you can define the look and feel of the child. By default it is displayed as a card. ```html Transparent! Hide/show title x: {{ cpWidget3.x }}
y: {{ cpWidget3.y }}
width: {{ cpWidget3.width }}
height: {{ cpWidget3.height }}
 ```

setSignature.name: isFrozen
setSignature.rawdescription:
If a dashboard is frozen, all children cannot be moved
or resized.
setSignature.description: If a dashboard is frozen, all children cannot be moved or resized.

setSignature.name: pxWidth
setSignature.rawdescription: Updates the pixel width of the child (used for resizing)
setSignature.description: Updates the pixel width of the child (used for resizing)

setSignature.name: pxHeight
setSignature.rawdescription: Updates the pixel height of the child (used for resizing)
setSignature.description: Updates the pixel height of the child (used for resizing)
